nodes.name: Webhook Trigger - Appointment Confirmed
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Accept confirmed appointment data from Module 02 or manual trigger.
INPUTS: appointment_status.json with appointment_id, patient details, scheduled_time.
OUTPUTS: Parsed body as $json.
CONFIG: Set ALLOWED_ORIGINS for CORS, WEBHOOK_ID_TELEHEALTH for custom path.
INTEGRATION: Connects to Module 02 success response or standalone telehealth scheduler.
SECURITY: Validates origin to prevent unauthorized session creation.

nodes.name: Validate Appointment Data
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Ensure appointment is confirmed and required data present before creating telehealth session.
INPUTS: Webhook body with appointment confirmation status and details.
OUTPUTS: Routes to 'true' if appointment confirmed and valid, 'false' if not ready.
VALIDATION: Checks appointment_confirmed != false, appointment_id exists, valid email, scheduled_time present.
BUSINESS LOGIC: Prevents telehealth session creation for cancelled or unconfirmed appointments.

parameters.responseBody: ={{ { "success": false, "error": "Appointment not confirmed or missing required data", "message": "Cannot create telehealth session for unconfirmed appointment. Required: appointment_id, patient_email, scheduled_time, appointment_confirmed=true", "timestamp": $now.toISO() } }}

nodes.name: Return Validation Error
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Return 400 error when appointment not confirmed or data incomplete.
INPUTS: Triggered by validation failure.
OUTPUTS: HTTP 400 with error JSON explaining requirements.
ERROR HANDLING: Clear message to upstream system about why session wasn't created.
SECURITY: Prevents unauthorized or premature session generation.

nodes.name: Prepare Session Data
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Generate unique session ID and prepare data structure for telehealth platform API.
INPUTS: Validated appointment data from webhook.
OUTPUTS: Structured session object with ID, times, participants, settings.
LOGIC: Creates session_id from clinic_id + appointment_id + timestamp for uniqueness.
CONFIG: Uses env vars for duration, timezone, security settings (waiting room, recording, password).
CUSTOMIZATION: Modify settings logic for clinic-specific requirements (e.g., always record, no waiting room).

parameters.name: settings

nodes.name: Create Telehealth Session
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Create secure telehealth session in platform (Zoom/Doxy.me/Amwell).
INPUTS: Prepared session data with topic, time, duration, participants.
OUTPUTS: Session object with join URLs, meeting ID, password (if enabled).
PLATFORMS: 
  - Zoom for Healthcare: POST /meetings (OAuth2)
  - Doxy.me: POST /api/v1/rooms (API key)
  - Amwell: POST /visits (OAuth2)
SECURITY: Enhanced encryption, waiting room, approval type 2 (manual admit).
TIMEOUT: 15s for API response.
ALTERNATES: Swap for platform-specific node or custom API integration.

nodes.name: Format Session Links
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Extract and normalize session URLs across different telehealth platforms.
INPUTS: Platform API response with meeting/room/visit details.
OUTPUTS: Standardized session object with patient_link, provider_link, password.
PLATFORM LOGIC:
  - Zoom: join_url (patient), start_url (host), password
  - Doxy.me: doxy.me/room_name, ?provider=true for host, PIN
  - Amwell: patient_url, provider_url, token-based
CUSTOMIZATION: Add logic for additional platforms or custom telehealth systems.
SECURITY: Separates patient and provider links with different permissions.

nodes.name: Update CRM with Session Details
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Update CRM contact with telehealth session details and status.
INPUTS: Formatted session data + contact_id from Module 02.
OUTPUTS: Updated CRM contact object.
FIELDS UPDATED: telehealth_status, session_link, session_id, platform, scheduled_time.
STATUS PROGRESSION: Moves appointment from 'SCHEDULED' to 'TELEHEALTH_READY'.
USE CASE: Provider dashboard shows which appointments have telehealth links generated.
ALTERNATES: Swap for Salesforce, Zoho, or custom CRM API.
ERROR HANDLING: If contact_id missing, logs session but skips CRM update.

nodes.name: Send Patient SMS Reminder
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Send SMS to patient with telehealth session link and details.
INPUTS: Formatted session data + patient phone from Module 02.
OUTPUTS: Twilio message SID and delivery status.
CONTENT: Date/time, provider name, clickable join link, password (if required), instructions.
BEST PRACTICE: Recommends joining 5 min early for tech check.
SECURITY: Link is unique per session, password included if enabled.
ALTERNATES: Replace with WhatsApp Business API, RCS, or patient portal notification.
COMPLIANCE: Ensure SMS consent obtained (TCPA), HIPAA-compliant Twilio account.

nodes.name: Send Patient Email Confirmation
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Send comprehensive email to patient with telehealth session details and instructions.
INPUTS: Formatted session data with links and password.
OUTPUTS: SendGrid message ID and delivery status.
CONTENT: 
  - Prominent join button with session link
  - Session password (if required)
  - Pre-appointment checklist (test tech, quiet space, documents)
  - Technical requirements (browser, device, internet)
  - Troubleshooting contact info
DESIGN: Responsive HTML, branded colors, clear call-to-action.
SECURITY: HIPAA compliance notice, encryption statement.
ALTERNATES: Swap for Mailgun, AWS SES, or patient portal notification.

nodes.name: Send Provider Email Notification
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Notify provider/staff that telehealth session is created and ready.
INPUTS: Formatted session data with host link.
OUTPUTS: SendGrid message ID.
CONTENT: Patient name, appointment time, host/start link, session credentials.
SECURITY: Host link has elevated permissions (start meeting, admit from waiting room, recording controls).
USE CASE: Provider can save link to EMR or calendar for easy access.
ALTERNATES: Replace with Slack notification, Microsoft Teams, or staff dashboard webhook.
OPTIONAL: Disable if provider receives calendar invite with host link automatically.

nodes.name: Log Session to Data Store
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Log telehealth session details for audit trail, analytics, and billing.
INPUTS: Complete session data with all metadata.
OUTPUTS: Append confirmation from Google Sheets.
FIELDS LOGGED: session_id, appointment_id, patient/provider info, links, scheduled time, platform.
COMPLIANCE: Maintains record of session creation for HIPAA audit requirements.
USE CASE: Analytics on telehealth usage, session completion rates, technical issues.
ALTERNATES: Swap for Airtable, database (PostgreSQL), or EMR integration.
SECURITY: Links contain sensitive session access - ensure sheet permissions restricted to authorized staff.

nodes.name: Merge All Notifications
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Consolidate outputs from CRM, SMS, emails, and logging into single response.
INPUTS: CRM update status, SMS delivery, patient email, provider email, data store confirmation.
OUTPUTS: Unified confirmation object with all delivery metadata.
USE CASE: Provides comprehensive delivery report for webhook response and monitoring.

nodes.name: Return Success Response
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Return standardized telehealth_record.json to caller.
INPUTS: Merged results from all workflow branches.
OUTPUTS: HTTP 200 with session details, links, and delivery metadata.
FORMAT: Includes session_id for tracking, patient/host links, password, all delivery statuses.
INTEGRATION: Output can trigger Module 04 (Pre-Visit Forms) or post-session follow-up workflows.
SECURITY: Response contains sensitive session links - ensure calling system secures data.
USE CASE: Upstream systems can store session_id and links for patient/provider access.

nodes.name: Error Handler
nodes.notes:
PURPOSE: Catch execution errors (API failures, network issues) and prevent workflow crash.
INPUTS: Any upstream error from telehealth API, CRM, SMS, or email nodes.
OUTPUTS: Error details for logging service.
BEST PRACTICE: Connect to error notification workflow or logging service in production.
RECOVERY: Can trigger fallback actions (e.g., manual session creation alert to staff).
CRITICAL: If session creation fails, must notify staff immediately to arrange alternative.

Returns standardized telehealth_record.json for downstream modules.
